comments: Starting rank of the (j-1)-Washtenaw series for the fixed ratio 2^(-j-1) (see Griess). - J. Taylor (jt_cpp(AT)yahoo.com), Apr 03 20041/4 + 1/32 + 1/256 + 1/2048 + ... = 2/7 [From _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 29 2008]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Robert L. Griess Jr. Pieces of 2^d: Existence and uniqueness for Barnes-Wall and Ypsilanti lattices. Mar 28 2004. See Definition 14.21.
formula: a(n)=8*a(n-1), n>0 ; a(0)=4 . G.f.: 4/(1-8x). [From _Philippe Del√©ham_, Nov 23 2008]a(n) = A198852(n) + 1. - _Michel Marcus_, Aug 23 2013
prog: (Sage) [lucas_number1(3*n, 2, 0) for n in xrange(1, 20)] # [From _Zerinvary Lajos_, Oct 27 2009](MAGMA) [2^(3*n+2): n in [0..20]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Jun 26 2011(PARI) a(n)=4<<(3*n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 07 2012
